oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Aerial view of Cravens House
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Aerial photograph of Cravens House and Chattanooga, Tennessee.

Originally the home of Robert Cravens, a prominent iron industrialist, it served as the Confederate headquarters of General Whitehall. General Joseph Hooker and his Union troops attacked on November 24, 1863, which resulted in it being General W. C. Whitaker's headquarters. Cravens rebuilt the home it was destroyed by Union soldiers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Houses; Military headquarters; Aerial views
